medical_history.chief_complaint: Adrenal cortical carcinoma arising in the context of Carney complex.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, a 22-year-old woman, initially presented with Cushing's syndrome and secondary amenorrhea. Laboratory studies revealed elevated cortisol and other steroid hormones. Three months post-surgery for an 8.5 cm adrenal mass, she reported right flank pain. Imaging showed a lesion in the tumor bed, indicative of recurrence, leading to further surgery after five months. Eventually, new metastatic disease was identified in the liver and lungs, requiring chemotherapy and radiation therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Carney complex, which includes features such as multiple pigmented lentigines and a history of an atrial myxoma requiring resection at age 22. Previously diagnosed with adrenal pathology consistent with primary pigmented nodular adrenocortical disease.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's mother was diagnosed with a right atrial myxoma at age 23 and has multiple pigmentary abnormalities suggestive of Carney complex.
